text: Terephthalic acid, also known by its systematic name benzene-1,4-dicarboxylic acid, is an organic chemical compound. It is one of the most important dicarboxylic acids, used to make plastics like polyethylene terephthalate (PET). == Production == Terephthalic acid was first found by distillation of turpentine. Most terephthalic acid today is made from p-xylene by oxidation. This is called the AMOCO process. == Related compounds == Terephthalic acid has two isomers, phthalic acid and isophthalic acid. == References == Category:Carboxylic acids Category:Aromatic compounds
title: Terephthalic acid
